thread.title: GODZone adventure race under way in Queenstown
thread.title_full: GODZone adventure race under way in Queenstown

title: GODZone adventure race under way in Queenstown
text:
GODZone adventure race under way in Queenstown Last updated 12:59, February 25 2017 GODZONE 
Competitors start the GODZone adventure race from Queenstown Bay on Saturday 
One of the World's toughest multi-sport races began from Queenstown at first light on Saturday with competitors faced with a seven-day, 420km journey across epic New Zealand back country. 
The GODZone adventure race attracted 280 competitors to the start line at 7am with hundreds of well-wishers lining Marine Parade to see them off. 
One of those was team Yealands Family Wine boasting world champion adventure racer Chris Forne who had been meticulous in his planning since the course was revealed on Friday. Supplied 
Teams start the GODZone adventure race from Queenstown bay on Saturday. 
Race Director Warren Bates said Forne had the binoculars out looking across Lake Wakatipu to plan the best route. 
READ MORE: 
"He was in full strategy mode planning his race teams movements around the course." Supplied 
Chris Forne at the first transition during the GODZone adventure race from Queenstown bay on Saturday. 
It was "tremendous" to see the teams run down the beach as the hooter sounded, Bates said.â€‹ 
"In the first five or six hours of the event all the teams are going to experience some of the amazing spots that all the locals enjoy here." 

One of the highlights of the day would be the pursuit teams abseiling off the historic Lower Shotover Bridge. 
The teams are expected to have completed stage one, which includes mountain running, biking, "gorgeering" and kayaking, into Arrowtown by nightfall. 
The field would then start stage two into the Skippers Canyon 33km away. 
The full first stage is an 11km trek up the Skyline, followed by a 19km mountain bike ride to Tuckers Beach and a 19km kayak to Chard Farm and a 49km journey on foot to Branches Station. 
Last year former All Blacks captain Richie McCaw completed GODZone , his first major challenge since captaining the All Blacks in the Rugby World Cup final in 2015. - Stuff
